Cleaned_Text: The Democratic Sta$ of the House Energy and Commerce Committee seeks qualiﬁed undergrad students and recent graduates for Legislative Interns for the Summer 2025 session.

Responsibilities: Processes incoming and outgoing communications to track and follow up on requests by sta$ and constituents.
Partners with the legislative sta$ to draft responses to constituent inquiries on an array of issue areas.
Performs research on issues or topics related to bills, committee hearings, and district and state concerns.
Attends meetings with constituents and assists the legislative sta$ prepare for hearings and mark-ups.

Cleaned_Text:
The Washington, D.C. office of Congresswoman Gwen Moore (WI-04) seeks interns for the upcoming Summer 2025 term.
Responsibilities include answering phones, attending hearings and brie\fidings, drafting and editing constituent correspondence letters, writing memos, conducting research for the legislative sta\$, drafting social media posts, designing graphics, and providing support for the day-to-day activities of the office. Interns are paid via a monthly stipend.
The O\ice of Congresswoman Moore is an equal opportunity employer. We do not 
} discriminate based on race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, or socioeconomic status.
All are welcome and encouraged to apply.
Interested applicants should send a resume, cover letter, and two short writing samples to WI04DC.Internships@mail.house.gov. Additionally, applicants should indicate their availability on both an hourly and monthly basis.
The deadline to apply is 6:00 PM ET on Friday, April 11th, 2025.
    ---

Responsibilities: leading tours of the U.S. Capitol
Assist with constituent correspondence and draft email blasts and other forms of outreach.
Attend virtual briefings and track virtual hearings.
Conduct legislative research on an as-needed basis.
Qualifications: Demonstrated interest in politics, policy and/or public service.
Ties to Tennessee’s 9th District are a bonus, but not required.
Equal_Opportunity_Information: The U.S. House of Representatives is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Qualifications: Work well under pressure in a team environment
Positive attitude and interest in politics
Cleaned_Text: Congressman Cory Mills' (FL-07) Washington, D.C. office is currently seeking qualified individuals to serve in his Washington, D.C. office for the Spring of 2025.

Congresswoman Suzan DelBene, representing the 1st Congressional District of Washington state, seeks interns for her Washington, D.C. and District o$ices. Interns will work in a fast-paced congressional o$ice, gaining valuable experience and knowledge of the United States Congress.
Intern responsibilities include greeting constituents and handling constituent phone calls,
asisting sta$ with administrative tasks, conducting research, and assisting with
constituent correspondence. Kirkland, WA interns will have the opportunity to attend
community events and tours with the Congresswoman and sta$. Washington, D.C. interns
will have the opportunity to lead tours of the U.S. Capitol as well as attend hearings and
brieﬁngs for the legislative sta$.
Qualiﬁcations: The ideal candidates will possess exceptional written and oral
communication skills, a high degree of professionalism, as well as a strong interest in
public service. Washington state ties are a plus but are not required.
Apply: To apply, please submit a cover letter, resume, and short writing sample (1 to 2
pages) through this form.
The deadline for Summer 2025 Internship Applications is 11:59 PM on February 24,
2025.
Due to a high volume of applications, you will only be contacted if you are selected
to apply. This o$ice is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based
on race, religion, disability, age, ethnicity, national origin, sex, gender, LGBTQ
identiﬁcation, family status, or military status. Women, people of color,
and other members of traditionlly underrepresented communities are strongly encouraged
to apply.

No phone calls or walk ins - please email internship.delbene@mail.house.gov with any
questions or concerns.
